Required Characteristics: Model of trawl (optional) + Perimeter of opening
Characteristic 1 - What It Means: Model: Optional text identifier for the specific trawl design/brand
Characteristic 2 - What It Means: Perimeter: Mandatory measurement in metres - circumference of the trawl net opening where fish enter
Registration Approach Recommendation: Gear Set Model - Register once with optional model identifier
Key Questions to Resolve: 1. Should "model" be free text or dropdown list? 2. How to validate perimeter values (min/max)?
Implementation Notes: Single registration covers the gear. Model field helps fishers distinguish between different trawls of same type.

Required Characteristics: Model of trawl (optional) + Perimeter of opening
Characteristic 1 - What It Means: Model: Optional text identifier for the specific trawl design
Characteristic 2 - What It Means: Perimeter: Mandatory - opening circumference in metres (typically smaller than general trawls)
Key Questions to Resolve: 1. Same as OTB - free text vs dropdown for model? 2. Any species-specific validation rules?
Implementation Notes: Specialized for Nephrops (Norway lobster) - may have typical size ranges to validate against.

Required Characteristics: Model of trawl (optional) + Perimeter of opening
Characteristic 1 - What It Means: Model: Optional trawl design identifier
Characteristic 2 - What It Means: Perimeter: Mandatory - net opening circumference in metres
Key Questions to Resolve: 1. Model field consistency across all trawl types? 2. Typical size ranges for shrimp trawls?
Implementation Notes: Smaller opening than general trawls typically. Consider validation ranges.

Required Characteristics: Model of trawl (optional) + Perimeter of opening
Characteristic 1 - What It Means: Model: Optional design identifier
Characteristic 2 - What It Means: Perimeter: Mandatory - opening size in metres (operated by two vessels)
Key Questions to Resolve: 1. Should system indicate this requires 2 vessels? 2. Coordination with other vessel's gear?
Implementation Notes: Pair trawling = 2 vessels. Consider if registration should link to partner vessel or just note the requirement.

Required Characteristics: Beam length of each beam + Number of beams towed
Characteristic 1 - What It Means: Beam length: Mandatory - length in metres of each individual rigid beam frame
Characteristic 2 - What It Means: Number of beams: Mandatory count - how many beams the vessel tows simultaneously
Registration Approach Recommendation: Gear Set Model - Register with per-beam dimension + total count
Key Questions to Resolve: 1. If beams have different lengths, register as separate gear entries? 2. Can number of beams change between trips?
Implementation Notes: Multiple beams common. If all beams same length = one entry. Mixed lengths = multiple entries or average?

Required Characteristics: Model (optional) + Perimeter per trawl + Number of trawls
Characteristic 1 - What It Means: Model: Optional trawl design identifier
Characteristic 2 - What It Means: Perimeter: Mandatory - opening size per individual trawl in metres
Characteristic 3 - What It Means: Number of trawls: Mandatory count - typically 2 for twin trawl
Registration Approach Recommendation: Gear Set Model - One entry representing the multi-trawl setup
Key Questions to Resolve: 1. Must there always be exactly 2 trawls (twin)? 2. If trawls have different perimeters, how to handle?
Implementation Notes: Twin = typically 2 trawls towed simultaneously. Register as one setup with dimensions per trawl.

Required Characteristics: Model (optional) + Perimeter per trawl + Number of trawls
Characteristic 1 - What It Means: Model: Optional design identifier
Characteristic 2 - What It Means: Perimeter: Mandatory - size per individual trawl in metres
Characteristic 3 - What It Means: Number of trawls: Mandatory count - 3 or more trawls
Key Questions to Resolve: 1. What's the maximum number of trawls typically used? 2. Same as OTT - handling different sizes?
Implementation Notes: More than 2 trawls. Same considerations as OTT but potentially more complex with 3+ units.

Required Characteristics: Model (optional) + Perimeter per trawl + Number of trawls
Characteristic 1 - What It Means: Model: Optional identifier
Characteristic 2 - What It Means: Perimeter: Mandatory per trawl in metres
Key Questions to Resolve: 1. This is a catch-all category - how to guide fishers to more specific types if known?
Implementation Notes: Catch-all for trawls not fitting other categories. May need help text to guide proper classification.

Required Characteristics: Model of trawl (optional) + Perimeter of opening
Characteristic 1 - What It Means: Model: Optional design identifier
Characteristic 2 - What It Means: Perimeter: Mandatory - opening circumference in metres (operates in water column, not on bottom)
Key Questions to Resolve: 1. Any different validation rules vs bottom trawls? 2. Should depth range be captured?
Implementation Notes: Mid-water = pelagic fishing. Opening may be larger than bottom trawls. Consider if depth/target species info useful.

Required Characteristics: Model of trawl (optional) + Perimeter of opening
Characteristic 1 - What It Means: Model: Optional identifier
Characteristic 2 - What It Means: Perimeter: Mandatory - opening size in metres (pair operation in mid-water)
Key Questions to Resolve: 1. Link to partner vessel like PTB? 2. Coordination requirements?
Implementation Notes: Pair operation in mid-water. Similar considerations to PTB.

Required Characteristics: Overall length + Maximum height of seine lines
Characteristic 1 - What It Means: Overall length: Mandatory - total length of seine rope/line in metres
Characteristic 2 - What It Means: Maximum height: Mandatory - vertical height of the net in metres
Key Questions to Resolve: 1. Length = just rope or rope + net? 2. Height measured when deployed or maximum possible?
Implementation Notes: Seine = encircling net with ropes. Length includes long rope lines, height is net depth.

Required Characteristics: Overall length + Maximum height of seine lines
Characteristic 1 - What It Means: Overall length: Mandatory - total seine line length in metres
Characteristic 2 - What It Means: Maximum height: Mandatory - net height in metres
Key Questions to Resolve: 1. Difference from Danish seine in measurements? 2. Any Scotland-specific rules?
Implementation Notes: Technique differs from Danish seine but measurements similar.

Required Characteristics: Overall length + Maximum height of seine lines
Characteristic 1 - What It Means: Overall length: Mandatory - seine line length in metres
Characteristic 2 - What It Means: Maximum height: Mandatory - net height in metres
Key Questions to Resolve: 1. Two vessels - link registrations? 2. Each vessel registers separately or one lead vessel?
Implementation Notes: Operated by two vessels. Consider vessel coordination implications.

Required Characteristics: Overall length + Maximum height of seine lines
Characteristic 1 - What It Means: Overall length: Mandatory - line length in metres
Characteristic 2 - What It Means: Maximum height: Mandatory - net height in metres
Key Questions to Resolve: 1. Guide to more specific seine types when possible?
Implementation Notes: Catch-all for unspecified seines. Provide guidance to classify more specifically.

Required Characteristics: Overall length + Maximum height of seine lines
Characteristic 1 - What It Means: Overall length: Mandatory - line length in metres
Characteristic 2 - What It Means: Maximum height: Mandatory - net height in metres
Key Questions to Resolve: 1. What distinguishes this from other seine types?
Implementation Notes: Specific seine variant. Clarify distinguishing features.

Required Characteristics: Overall length + Maximum height of seine lines
Characteristic 1 - What It Means: Overall length: Mandatory - line length in metres
Characteristic 2 - What It Means: Maximum height: Mandatory - net height in metres
Key Questions to Resolve: 1. Shore-based operation - different validation? 2. Typically smaller scale?
Implementation Notes: Shore-based seining. May have different typical size ranges. One end stays on shore.

Required Characteristics: Length + (Maximum) height of nets
Characteristic 1 - What It Means: Length: Mandatory - total net length in metres when fully extended
Characteristic 2 - What It Means: Height: Mandatory - maximum depth the net reaches in metres
Key Questions to Resolve: 1. Large scale gear - validate against vessel size? 2. "Maximum" height = deepest point?
Implementation Notes: Large encircling net that "purses" closed at bottom. Significant gear - may want vessel size checks.

Required Characteristics: Length + (Maximum) height of nets
Characteristic 1 - What It Means: Length: Mandatory - net length in metres
Characteristic 2 - What It Means: Height: Mandatory - maximum depth in metres
Key Questions to Resolve: 1. Typically smaller than two-boat version?
Implementation Notes: Single vessel operation. May have different size characteristics than PS2.

Required Characteristics: Length + (Maximum) height of nets
Characteristic 1 - What It Means: Length: Mandatory - net length in metres
Characteristic 2 - What It Means: Height: Mandatory - maximum depth in metres
Key Questions to Resolve: 1. Vessel coordination considerations? 2. Larger scale than PS1?
Implementation Notes: Two vessel operation. Coordination and size considerations.

Required Characteristics: Length + (Maximum) height of nets
Characteristic 1 - What It Means: Length: Mandatory - net length in metres
Characteristic 2 - What It Means: Height: Mandatory - net depth in metres
Key Questions to Resolve: 1. Different closing mechanism - affects measurements?
Implementation Notes: Lampara-style net without purse mechanism. Traditional Mediterranean gear.

Required Characteristics: Length + (Maximum) height of nets
Characteristic 1 - What It Means: Length: Mandatory - net length in metres
Characteristic 2 - What It Means: Height: Mandatory - net depth in metres
Key Questions to Resolve: 1. Guide to specific types when known?
Implementation Notes: Catch-all category. Encourage specific classification.

Required Characteristics: Maximum perimeter per net + Number of nets (if >1)
Characteristic 1 - What It Means: Maximum perimeter: Mandatory - circumference of the net frame in metres (per individual net)
Characteristic 2 - What It Means: Number of nets: MANDATORY if using more than 1 net, OPTIONAL if only 1 net
Registration Approach Recommendation: Gear Set Model with conditional count
Key Questions to Resolve: 1. If using 1 net, should count field be hidden or show "1"? 2. Track individual net IDs?
Implementation Notes: Conditional logic: number field required only if >1. Consider UX for single vs multiple nets.

Required Characteristics: Maximum perimeter per net + Number of nets (if >1)
Characteristic 1 - What It Means: Maximum perimeter: Mandatory - net frame perimeter in metres per unit
Characteristic 2 - What It Means: Number of nets: MANDATORY if >1, OPTIONAL if 1
Registration Approach Recommendation: Gear Set Model with conditional count
Key Questions to Resolve: 1. Operated from boat - size limits based on vessel? 2. Same conditional logic as LNP?
Implementation Notes: Boat-based operation. May have vessel size constraints.

Required Characteristics: Maximum perimeter per net + Number of nets (if >1)
Characteristic 1 - What It Means: Maximum perimeter: Mandatory - perimeter per net in metres
Characteristic 2 - What It Means: Number of nets: MANDATORY if >1, OPTIONAL if 1
Registration Approach Recommendation: Gear Set Model with conditional count
Key Questions to Resolve: 1. Shore-based = fixed locations? 2. Need location tracking?
Implementation Notes: Shore-based, stationary. May need location data (coordinates or named location).

Required Characteristics: Maximum perimeter per net + Number of nets (if >1)
Characteristic 1 - What It Means: Maximum perimeter: Mandatory - perimeter in metres per net
Characteristic 2 - What It Means: Number of nets: MANDATORY if >1, OPTIONAL if 1
Registration Approach Recommendation: Gear Set Model with conditional count
Key Questions to Resolve: 1. Guide to specific lift net types?
Implementation Notes: Catch-all category. Provide classification guidance.

Required Characteristics: Maximum perimeter per net/device + Number (if >1)
Characteristic 1 - What It Means: Maximum perimeter: Mandatory - circumference of the cast net in metres when fully opened
Characteristic 2 - What It Means: Number: MANDATORY if >1, OPTIONAL if 1
Registration Approach Recommendation: Gear Set Model with conditional count
Key Questions to Resolve: 1. Typically small, hand-thrown - validate size ranges? 2. Usually one per fisher?
Implementation Notes: Small-scale gear, hand-thrown. Typically individual fishers use one net.

Required Characteristics: Maximum perimeter per net/device + Number (if >1)
Characteristic 1 - What It Means: Maximum perimeter: Mandatory - perimeter of device opening in metres
Characteristic 2 - What It Means: Number: MANDATORY if >1, OPTIONAL if 1
Registration Approach Recommendation: Gear Set Model with conditional count
Key Questions to Resolve: 1. What exactly is a cover pot/lantern net? Need clarification?
Implementation Notes: Specialized gear type. May need reference images or descriptions for fishers.

Required Characteristics: Maximum perimeter per net/device + Number (if >1)
Characteristic 1 - What It Means: Maximum perimeter: Mandatory - device perimeter in metres
Characteristic 2 - What It Means: Number: MANDATORY if >1, OPTIONAL if 1
Registration Approach Recommendation: Gear Set Model with conditional count
Key Questions to Resolve: 1. Guide to specific types when possible?
Implementation Notes: Catch-all category. Encourage specific classification.

Required Characteristics: Width of each dredge + Number of dredges (if >1)
Characteristic 1 - What It Means: Width: Mandatory - width of individual dredge basket/frame in metres
Characteristic 2 - What It Means: Number: MANDATORY if >1, OPTIONAL if 1
Registration Approach Recommendation: Gear Set Model with conditional count
Key Questions to Resolve: 1. Width = working width or frame width? 2. Multiple dredges common?
Implementation Notes: Towed behind vessel. Width is key dimension. Multiple dredges can be ganged together.

Required Characteristics: Width of each dredge + Number of dredges (if >1)
Characteristic 1 - What It Means: Width: Mandatory - dredge width in metres (typically smaller than towed)
Characteristic 2 - What It Means: Number: MANDATORY if >1, OPTIONAL if 1
Registration Approach Recommendation: Gear Set Model with conditional count
Key Questions to Resolve: 1. Hand-operated = size limits? 2. Usually just one?
Implementation Notes: Hand-operated, small scale. Typically one dredge per fisher.

Required Characteristics: Width of each dredge + Number of dredges (if >1)
Characteristic 1 - What It Means: Width: Mandatory - dredge width in metres
Characteristic 2 - What It Means: Number: MANDATORY if >1, OPTIONAL if 1
Registration Approach Recommendation: Gear Set Model with conditional count
Key Questions to Resolve: 1. Mechanized = hydraulic? 2. Power source relevant to register?
Implementation Notes: Mechanically powered dredge. May have different regulations based on power.

Required Characteristics: Width of each dredge + Number of dredges (if >1)
Characteristic 1 - What It Means: Width: Mandatory - dredge width in metres
Characteristic 2 - What It Means: Number: MANDATORY if >1, OPTIONAL if 1
Registration Approach Recommendation: Gear Set Model with conditional count
Key Questions to Resolve: 1. Guide to specific dredge types?
Implementation Notes: Catch-all category. Provide classification guidance.

Required Characteristics: Overall length(¹) + Height of nets
Characteristic 1 - What It Means: Overall length: Mandatory - total length when deployed in metres (¹cumulative for aggregated reporting)
Characteristic 2 - What It Means: Height: Mandatory - vertical height/depth of net in metres
Registration Approach Recommendation: Gear Set Model - Note aggregated reporting rule
Key Questions to Resolve: 1. Register total length owned or typical deployment length? 2. Aggregation happens at reporting, not registration?
Implementation Notes: (¹) IMPORTANT: Aggregated reporting rule applies when REPORTING usage, not during registration. At registration, capture typical/total gear length owned.

Required Characteristics: Overall length(¹) + Height of nets
Characteristic 1 - What It Means: Overall length: Mandatory - total net length in metres
Characteristic 2 - What It Means: Height: Mandatory - net depth in metres
Key Questions to Resolve: 1. "Anchored" = fixed location - need location data? 2. Length = single net or string of nets?
Implementation Notes: Set = stationary nets anchored in place. Length could be single net or connected series.

Required Characteristics: Overall length(¹) + Height of nets
Characteristic 1 - What It Means: Overall length: Mandatory - length in metres (drifts with current)
Characteristic 2 - What It Means: Height: Mandatory - net depth in metres
Key Questions to Resolve: 1. Drift nets = mobile - different rules? 2. Some regions ban drift nets?
Implementation Notes: Drift = moves with current/tide. May have restrictions in some areas. Check local regulations.

Required Characteristics: Overall length(¹) + Height of nets
Characteristic 1 - What It Means: Overall length: Mandatory - net length in metres (set in circle/arc)
Characteristic 2 - What It Means: Height: Mandatory - net depth in metres
Key Questions to Resolve: 1. Circling = surrounds area? 2. Length = arc length?
Implementation Notes: Set in circular/arc pattern. Length measurement represents arc perimeter.

Required Characteristics: Overall length(¹) + Height of nets
Characteristic 1 - What It Means: Overall length: Mandatory - length in metres (permanently staked)
Characteristic 2 - What It Means: Height: Mandatory - net depth in metres
Key Questions to Resolve: 1. Fixed on stakes = permanent installation? 2. Need location registration?
Implementation Notes: Permanently fixed nets on stakes. May require location data, possibly permits.

Required Characteristics: Overall length(¹) + Height of nets
Characteristic 1 - What It Means: Overall length: Mandatory - total length in metres (combination design)
Characteristic 2 - What It Means: Height: Mandatory - net depth in metres
Key Questions to Resolve: 1. Combination gear - clarify the design difference?
Implementation Notes: Specialized combination design. May need explanation of structure.

Required Characteristics: Overall length(¹) + Height of nets
Characteristic 1 - What It Means: Overall length: Mandatory - length in metres (three-layer net design)
Characteristic 2 - What It Means: Height: Mandatory - net depth in metres
Key Questions to Resolve: 1. Three layers - affects measurements?
Implementation Notes: Three-layer net design (two outer walls, one inner). Structure more complex than simple gillnet.

Gear Type Name: Gillnets and entangling nets (not elsewhere specified)
Required Characteristics: Overall length(¹) + Height of nets
Characteristic 1 - What It Means: Overall length: Mandatory - length in metres
Characteristic 2 - What It Means: Height: Mandatory - depth in metres
Key Questions to Resolve: 1. Guide to specific gillnet types?
Implementation Notes: Catch-all category. Encourage specific classification.

Required Characteristics: Number of pots (e.g. creels) used(¹)
Characteristic 1 - What It Means: Number of pots: Mandatory - total count of pots/creels owned (¹cumulative count for aggregated reporting)
Characteristic 2 - What It Means: N/A
Registration Approach Recommendation: Gear Set Model - Simple count only
Key Questions to Resolve: 1. Just count or also track individual pot IDs? 2. How to handle lost pots - reduce count or mark separately? 3. Distinguish between "owned" vs "in use"?
Implementation Notes: Simplest gear registration - just a count. (¹) Aggregation rule: sum across hauls when reporting, but at registration this is total pots owned/available.

Required Characteristics: Overall length + Height of wings/leaders per net + Number of nets
Characteristic 1 - What It Means: Overall length: Mandatory - combined length of wings and leaders in metres (per individual fyke net)
Characteristic 2 - What It Means: Height: Mandatory - vertical height of wings/leaders in metres
Characteristic 3 - What It Means: Number: Mandatory - count of fyke nets in this gear set
Registration Approach Recommendation: Gear Set Model OR Individual Unit Model (DECISION NEEDED)
Key Questions to Resolve: 1. CRITICAL: Register as set (one entry for multiple identical nets) or individually (one entry per net)? 2. If mixed sizes, must register separately? 3. How to handle adding/removing nets from set?
Implementation Notes: MOST COMPLEX trap type. Multiple measurements per unit PLUS count. Key decision point for registration model. See earlier discussion on Approach A vs B vs C.

Required Characteristics: Length + Height of frame
Characteristic 1 - What It Means: Length: Mandatory - length of the net frame in metres
Characteristic 2 - What It Means: Height: Mandatory - height of frame structure in metres
Key Questions to Resolve: 1. Frame dimensions = outer frame or net dimensions?
Implementation Notes: Fixed frame trap. Frame is structural component - clarify measurement points.

Required Characteristics: Total length + Height
Characteristic 1 - What It Means: Total length: Mandatory - full length of barrier/fence/weir in metres
Characteristic 2 - What It Means: Height: Mandatory - vertical height in metres
Key Questions to Resolve: 1. Permanent structures? 2. Need location/coordinates? 3. Permit requirements?
Implementation Notes: Large fixed structures. Likely require permits and location data. May be permanent installations.

Required Characteristics: Length + Height underwater + Length + Height aerial
Characteristic 1 - What It Means: Length underwater: Mandatory - underwater portion length in metres
Characteristic 2 - What It Means: Height underwater: Mandatory - underwater portion height in metres
Characteristic 3 - What It Means: Length aerial: Mandatory - above-water portion length in metres + Height aerial: Mandatory - above-water height in metres
Registration Approach Recommendation: Individual Unit Model - Four separate measurements required
Key Questions to Resolve: 1. CRITICAL: How to capture 4 measurements in form? Four separate fields? 2. What exactly is an aerial trap - need definition? 3. Validation rules for proportions?
Implementation Notes: MOST COMPLEX measurements - 4 required dimensions (underwater L+H, aerial L+H). Form UX challenge. Need clear visual guide for fishers. May need diagram.

Required Characteristics: Overall length + Height of wings and leaders
Characteristic 1 - What It Means: Overall length: Mandatory - combined length of wings/leaders in metres
Characteristic 2 - What It Means: Height: Mandatory - height of wing/leader structures in metres
Key Questions to Resolve: 1. Similar to fyke nets but "stationary uncovered" - how different? 2. Fixed location needs coordinates?
Implementation Notes: Similar structure to fyke nets (wings/leaders) but stationary and uncovered. May need location data.

Required Characteristics: Dimensions + Description + Number of gears
Characteristic 1 - What It Means: Dimensions: Mandatory - key measurements in metres (free text or structured?)
Characteristic 2 - What It Means: Description: Mandatory - text description of gear type/design
Characteristic 3 - What It Means: Number: Mandatory - count of gear units
Registration Approach Recommendation: Hybrid Model - Requires free text description
Key Questions to Resolve: 1. CRITICAL: How to capture flexible "dimensions" - free text field or predefined dimension types? 2. Description field = free text or dropdown options? 3. Validation challenges?
Implementation Notes: CATCH-ALL trap category with FREE TEXT requirements. Most flexible but hardest to standardize. May need examples/templates to guide fishers.

Required Characteristics: Total number of lines(¹) + Total number of hooks(¹) + Size of hooks
Characteristic 1 - What It Means: Number of lines: Mandatory - count of fishing lines
Characteristic 2 - What It Means: Number of hooks: Mandatory - total hooks across all lines
Characteristic 3 - What It Means: Hook size: Mandatory - hook size measurement (what unit? mm? size code?)
Key Questions to Resolve: 1. Hook size = numeric measurement or code (e.g. "#4")? 2. (¹)Aggregation: at registration, total gear owned or typical deployment? 3. If multiple hook sizes, register separately?
Implementation Notes: Three measurements needed. Hook size needs unit/standard definition. Consider aggregated reporting rule.

Required Characteristics: Total number of lines(¹) + Total number of hooks(¹) + Size of hooks
Characteristic 1 - What It Means: Number of lines: Mandatory - line count
Characteristic 2 - What It Means: Number of hooks: Mandatory - total hook count
Key Questions to Resolve: 1. "Mechanised" = powered? Need power info? 2. Same hook size questions as LHP?
Implementation Notes: Mechanized version. May have different capacity/scale. Hook size standardization critical.

Required Characteristics: Total number of lines(¹) + Total number of hooks(¹) + Size of hooks
Characteristic 1 - What It Means: Number of lines: Mandatory - line count (vertical fishing)
Characteristic 2 - What It Means: Number of hooks: Mandatory - hook count
Key Questions to Resolve: 1. Vertical = jigging style? Different hook requirements?
Implementation Notes: Vertical fishing method. Technique differs but measurements similar.

Required Characteristics: Total number of lines(¹) + Total number of hooks(¹) + Size of hooks
Characteristic 1 - What It Means: Number of lines: Mandatory - line count (trolled behind boat)
Characteristic 2 - What It Means: Number of hooks: Mandatory - hook count
Key Questions to Resolve: 1. Trolling = moving lines - affects measurements?
Implementation Notes: Lines dragged behind moving vessel. Active fishing method.

Required Characteristics: Total number of lines(¹) + Total number of hooks(¹) + Size of hooks
Characteristic 1 - What It Means: Number of lines: Mandatory - line count
Characteristic 2 - What It Means: Number of hooks: Mandatory - hook count
Key Questions to Resolve: 1. Guide to specific hook/line types?
Implementation Notes: Catch-all category. Encourage specific classification.

Required Characteristics: Overall length of lines(¹) + Total number of hooks(¹) + Size of hooks
Characteristic 1 - What It Means: Line length: Mandatory - total length of main line in metres
Characteristic 2 - What It Means: Number of hooks: Mandatory - total hooks on line
Key Questions to Resolve: 1. Length = main line only or including branch lines? 2. Large scale gear - validate against vessel size?
Implementation Notes: Long main line with many branch lines/hooks. Length measurement needs clarification (main line vs total).

Required Characteristics: Overall length of lines(¹) + Total number of hooks(¹) + Size of hooks
Characteristic 1 - What It Means: Line length: Mandatory - total line length in metres (drifts with current)
Characteristic 2 - What It Means: Number of hooks: Mandatory - hook count
Key Questions to Resolve: 1. Drift longline = pelagic fishing? 2. Different regulations than set longlines?
Implementation Notes: Drifts with current instead of anchored. May have different rules/restrictions.

Required Characteristics: Overall length of lines(¹) + Total number of hooks(¹) + Size of hooks
Characteristic 1 - What It Means: Line length: Mandatory - line length in metres
Characteristic 2 - What It Means: Number of hooks: Mandatory - hook count
Key Questions to Resolve: 1. Guide to set vs drift classification?
Implementation Notes: Catch-all longline category. Encourage specific type selection.

Required Characteristics: Dimensions + Description + Number of gears
Characteristic 1 - What It Means: Dimensions: Mandatory - key measurements (length? free text?)
Characteristic 2 - What It Means: Description: Mandatory - text description of harpoon type
Registration Approach Recommendation: Gear Set Model with free text
Key Questions to Resolve: 1. Dimensions = just length or more detail? 2. Traditional vs modern harpoons - different data?
Implementation Notes: Simple tool but free text fields. May need standardization guidance.

Required Characteristics: Dimensions + Description + Number of gears
Characteristic 1 - What It Means: Dimensions: Mandatory - measurements of implement
Characteristic 2 - What It Means: Description: Mandatory - type of implement and details
Registration Approach Recommendation: Gear Set Model with free text
Key Questions to Resolve: 1. Wide variety of tools - how to standardize? 2. Each type needs separate registration?
Implementation Notes: Very broad category covering multiple tool types. Hard to standardize. May need subcategories.

Required Characteristics: Dimensions + Description + Number of gears
Characteristic 1 - What It Means: Dimensions: Mandatory - pump capacity/size measurements
Characteristic 2 - What It Means: Description: Mandatory - pump type and specifications
Key Questions to Resolve: 1. Dimensions = flow rate? physical size? 2. Suction fishing = special regulations?
Implementation Notes: Pumping devices for harvesting. May have specific regulations around suction fishing.

Required Characteristics: Dimensions + Description + Number of gears
Characteristic 1 - What It Means: Dimensions: Mandatory - net dimensions (width/length)
Characteristic 2 - What It Means: Description: Mandatory - pushnet design details
Key Questions to Resolve: 1. Common dimensions to standardize? Width? Depth?
Implementation Notes: Nets pushed through water/substrate. Likely have typical dimension patterns.

Required Characteristics: Dimensions + Description + Number of gears
Characteristic 1 - What It Means: Dimensions: Mandatory - net dimensions (diameter/depth)
Characteristic 2 - What It Means: Description: Mandatory - scoopnet type
Key Questions to Resolve: 1. Diameter and depth most relevant? Standardize these?
Implementation Notes: Hand-held scoop nets. Likely have standard dimensions to capture.

Required Characteristics: Dimensions + Description + Number of gears
Characteristic 1 - What It Means: Dimensions: Mandatory - net dimensions
Characteristic 2 - What It Means: Description: Mandatory - net design and use
Key Questions to Resolve: 1. What exactly is a drive-in net? Need definition?
Implementation Notes: Specialized technique. May need explanation/examples for fishers.

Required Characteristics: Dimensions + Description + Number of gears
Characteristic 1 - What It Means: Dimensions: Mandatory - relevant measurements (depth rating? free text?)
Characteristic 2 - What It Means: Description: Mandatory - diving method/equipment details
Characteristic 3 - What It Means: Number: Mandatory - count (divers? sets of equipment?)
Key Questions to Resolve: 1. UNUSUAL: "Number" = divers or equipment sets? 2. Dimensions = depth rating? equipment specs? 3. Should this even be "gear" or a fishing method?
Implementation Notes: UNUSUAL category - diving is a method not physical gear. May need rethinking of data model. What are we actually registering?

Required Characteristics: Dimensions + Description + Number of gears
Characteristic 1 - What It Means: Dimensions: Mandatory - machine specifications
Characteristic 2 - What It Means: Description: Mandatory - machine type and capacity
Key Questions to Resolve: 1. Very broad category - dredges, rakes, etc? 2. Power source relevant?
Implementation Notes: Mechanical harvesting equipment. Very broad - may need subcategories. Overlap with dredges?

Required Characteristics: Dimensions + Description + Number of gears
Characteristic 1 - What It Means: Dimensions: Mandatory - relevant measurements
Characteristic 2 - What It Means: Description: Mandatory - gear description
Characteristic 3 - What It Means: Number: Mandatory - count of gear units
Registration Approach Recommendation: Gear Set Model with free text
Key Questions to Resolve: 1. Ultimate catch-all - should strongly guide to specific types 2. Validation challenges 3. Examples needed
Implementation Notes: Ultimate catch-all category. Should be rare - guide users to specific categories. Need strong help text and examples.
